SEARCH
Package gw.api.inboundfile

Class YamlInboundRecordReader

java.lang.Object
gw.api.inboundfile.InboundRecordReader
gw.api.inboundfile.YamlInboundRecordReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class YamlInboundRecordReader extends InboundRecordReader
A reader that will parse either a single YAML object or an array of YAML objects. If there is an array it will create a record for each array element. It will NOT parse a file with multiple documents. If your file has multiple documents then use YamlMultiDocTextRecordReader There is also a static helper method to parse the record's content into map see parse(entity.InboundRecord, java.lang.Class) or object parse(entity.InboundRecord) Typically your handler subclass implementation would look something like: 
invalid input: '{@code
 class YamlExampleInboundHandler extends BaseInboundFileHandler {
   public construct(inboundFileConfig : InboundFileConfig) { super(inboundFileConfig) }
   override public function createReader(final inboundFileBean : InboundFile, final inputStream : InputStream, lineCounter : AtomicInteger) : InboundRecordReader {
     return new YamlInboundRecordReader(InboundFileConfig, inboundFileBean, inputStream)
   }
   override public function process(record : InboundRecord, bundle : Bundle, logger : IntentionalLogger, marker : Marker) : void {
     var map = YamlInboundRecordReader.parse(record);
     // do something here with the map
   }
 }</pre>'

  • Method Details

    • parse

      public static Map<String,Object> parse(InboundRecord rec) throws IOException
      Parse the record's content into a map. This typically is called in the specific implementation's process method which is called by the work queue executor.
      Parameters:
      rec - an record created above.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there are problems parsing the YAML

    • parse

      public static <T> T parse(InboundRecord rec, Class<T> type) throws IOException
      This will create a object from the YAML. This typically is called when the content represents a POJO, that is known to the file creator and the handler implementation.
      Parameters:
      rec - created above
      type - the type to create
      Throws:
      IOException - if there are problems parsing the YAML

    • readRecord

      public InboundRecord readRecord(Bundle bundle) throws IOException
      Description copied from class: InboundRecordReader
      This method returns the next record. This should be a newly record created in supplied bundle. Implementer note -- this needs to be implemented. There are helper methods: InboundRecordReader.createInboundRecord(Bundle, InboundRecordStatus, String, Integer) and InboundRecordReader.addInboundSubRecord(InboundRecord, String, Integer) to help you construct that record. For example BaseInboundFileHandler could implement its createReader: 
      
   final AtomicBoolean done = new AtomicBoolean();
   return new InboundRecordReader(_config, inboundFileBean) {
     public InboundRecord readRecord(Bundle bundle) throws IOException {
       if (!done.get()) {
         done.set(true);
         return createInboundRecord(bundle, InboundRecordStatus.TC_PENDING, StreamUtil.toString(StreamUtil.getContent(inputStream)), 0);
       }
       return null;
      }
     };
      Specified by:
      readRecord in class InboundRecordReader
      Parameters:
      bundle - the bundle to create new beans in
      Returns:
      a new InboundRecord in the current bundle (note that it will have its chunk set after it's returned and before it's committed)
      Throws:
      IOException
